All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Iterable<E>, SweepArea<I,E>, Decorator<SweepArea<I,E>>, MemoryManageable, MemoryMonitorable, MetaDataManageable<java.lang.Object,java.lang.Object>, MetaDataProvider<CompositeMetaData<java.lang.Object,java.lang.Object>>
public class DefaultMemoryManageableSA<I,E>
extends MemoryManageableSA<I,E>

Default implementation for a memory manageable SweepArea. If this SweepArea reaches its limit of main memory, it randomly drops 20% of its content (load shedding).

public DefaultMemoryManageableSA(SweepArea<I,E> sweepArea,
                                 int objectSize,
                                 int memSize)
Creates a memory manageable SweepArea by decorating the underlying SweepArea.

Parameters:
sweepArea - The underlying SweepArea
objectSize - The size of the objects in this SweepArea (in bytes).
memSize - The preferred amount of memory (in bytes).

handleOverflow

public void handleOverflow()
This method handles an overflow. If there is an overflow, this method causes a dropping of tuples, until this SweepArea uses only 80% of its assigned memory amount. The dropping of tuples occurs uniformly distributed among the tuples in the SweepArea according to the order the iterator()-method supplies the tuples.

Specified by:
handleOverflow in class MemoryManageableSA<I,E>

getObjectSize

public int getObjectSize()
Description copied from interface: MemoryManageable
Returns the estimated size of the objects which are stored in the memory of this memory monitorable object. This method can be called from the strategy of the memory manager to obtain useful information for distributing main memory among the memory using objects.

Specified by:
getObjectSize in interface MemoryManageable
Overrides:
getObjectSize in class AbstractSweepArea<I,E>
Returns:
Returns the size of a single object (in bytes).
